channel.title: Moparscape Dieing?
channel.description:
Is moparscape dieing? I know this question is always being asked around this time of the year and i know we always get about 300+ more users @ November/December but i'm afraid that this year we won't for a few reasons.
1. RSPS in general is dieing, people are moving away from RSPS and towards Macros like Rsbot and less and less people know about it
2. Moparscape is usually the first community people come to, they make a account, post 3 times, THEN 4/8 of people quit, 3/8 go to another community, and a rare 1/8 stay and post actively
The only solution i can think of is that we need to recruit more Help section mods (Not necessarily 'mods') because that is the main reason people quit; they can't code so they post in the help section, then they don't get help within the first 2 hours of posting so they quit. We could recruit about 20 users (So there are some online at some point) that will respond to the topics and not have like 2 word replys, They would reply so that the person that needs help would learn more about java while finding a solution to their problem.
We could also make a new section just for these 'helpers' to post so that the people that want GUARANTEED correct help can post there.

item.title: Moparscape Dieing?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“xxlukexx, post:64, topic:310648”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=407075.msg3011721#msg3011721 date=1256842161]
MoparScape isn’t dying. If the members put a little more effort into their posts, contributed more, and learned to be mature, this community would start to thrive. The staff members are doing a great job keeping this community up, and if MoparScape is really dying, it’s a result of the immaturity of the regular members on here.

Take this thread, for example. A good half of the posts on this thread contain spam, flaming, etc. Every member spams once in a while, but this excessive spam isn’t needed.
[/quote]

new members come every day with the same questions that we answer day in and day out…

why should we have to keep on answering the same questions for the lazy people when they can use the search button, even then they don’t use it.

also, not having atleast 1 simple basic tutorial in the tutorial section doesn’t help for new members.

this site (not from what i know of) has 1 single tutorial (as they have been deleted, tell me if im wrong) that can help people who need to know a simple thing, as from when they post in the help section, its usually just spoon feeding and they arn’t learning anything at all.[/quote]

We should aid the new members, even if the requests are repetitious.

Just because they don’t know how to use the search bar, doesn’t mean we should flame them. That’s why there’s a help section.

Most of the tutorials in the tutorial section are extremely basic, lol.

If you think spoon-feeding is a problem, suggest a way on how to prevent it. Sometimes things need to be spoon-fed.

Read full topic

@_jeba wrote:

Mortality means that you are able to die, immortality would prove to be ‘invincable’ per-say, not bullet proof due to pain being a factor of life, but you’d never die.

Basically, mortality means you’re going to die at some stage.

item.title: Moparscape Dieing?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

9) The “leeched” concept.

[quote=“Thug-life”]Quote from: Thug-life on June 19, 2008, 04:36:27 pm

I’ll add this to the rules after i feel its been taken to by the members.

Well since you have all been ignoring or just not understanding it so i’ll make it clear here. Whenever you post a server or a client with the source code included you agree to the fact other people can use it. If you don’t want people “Leeching” your work then you do not release it, simple as.

Even still, most of you are using wL based servers and have no right in claiming that as your own, same with jagex’s client. You however can credit yourself for whatever code you have added and if the code you have added is someone elses then you credit them either in the topic and in comments in the source code.

Basically:

[quote author=Moparisthebest]Quote from: Moparisthebest on June 18, 2008, 04:51:37 am
Just make them all credit winterlove and daiki…
[/quote]
I’ll add, credit Jagex and if you have used anyone elses code they have released and you have added that code to the client or the server credit them too.

Percentages:
Just name the people you are crediting, don’t bother making up random percentages unless you can provide the equations on how you get these percentages.

[quote author=Projext]Quote from: Projext on June 20, 2008, 10:25:32 pm
So like instead of going
Code:

10% credit to you
and 90% credits to me!

Make like a list of all the people who helped and contributed into your productions and end results which are out for release

EG:


Thug-Life
Projext
_Reforced
More Names

And don’t forget anyone Wink
[/quote][/quote]

Since it is so typical that every server is based off of wL’s source, we don’t consider it leeching. Nor do we consider any other “blank” server leeching. The concept is used loosely, when you do nearly nothing to modify the server that you’ve downloaded. You’re taking it a bit to the extreme.

Read full topic
